Flexible Architecture. Industry-Agnostic. Privacy-First. frp® solutions are built for any industry, offering both frp® SaaS and frp® on-prem deployment models to meet your operational and compliance needs. With frp®hospitality, data is encrypted directly on edge devices — no proprietary cloud required. All personal data is securely stored and synchronized via your personal or corporate Google Account, ensuring full control and compliance with modern privacy standards. Mobile Punch Clock Say goodbye to expensive custom hardware, complicated setup, and maintenance. With frp®hospitality (RAU) for iOS and Android, you get a powerful, visual time tracking terminal—right in your pocket. Experience the simplicity of smart check-ins and visual logs, without the IT headache. Read More Tailored In-Location Campaigns & Insights Launch parallel marketing campaigns for your private label brands, personalized for each visitor. Collect gender-based analytics on new and returning customers to measure the true conversion impact of your advertising efforts. Read More Identity Verification Student Identity Verification for Exam Access. Ensure only authorized students gain entry to exam sessions with fast, secure identity verification at the point of check-in. Read More Video-Based Outdoor Access Transform any entry point into a secure checkpoint with facial recognition or QR key scanning — no proprietary hardware required outdoors. With edge-based processing, frp®hospitality eliminates the need to store sensitive data on conventional access control devices, delivering enhanced privacy, stronger security, and full regulatory compliance. frp®hospitality – is an application for access control to the premises. Collecting and Using personal data When you use frp®hospitality we collect general information about application usage, and license information without any personally identifiable information, to improve and develop, and enhance the application. All communication are encrypted. By installing HOST application, you agree to provide your personal or company contact information needed for license generation. Required fields are first name, last name and e-mail address. You can also opt in to receive newsletter from us. We do not verify the accuracy of this information. Any personal data provided by you and/or collected by us will be handled by us in an appropriate and considerate manner. We will only use your personal data to support our mutual relationship, to understand your needs and to improve our support for your needs. Our use of your personal data improves our offers and services to you, for instance, by helping you stay informed of new software versions. The collected information is retained for as long as necessary to provide the requested service. However, in compliance with the GDPR, if someone would like to make a subject access request, rectify or delete your data, restrict and object to processing or lodge a complaint with a data protection authority, they are perfectly entitled to do so. For this they contact our Support department with any such requests, and they will strive to respond to him/her in no later than 30 days. Any personally identifying information is not shared publicly or with third-parties, except when legally required to do so. When the information can be shared? The information may be disclosed to Service Providers approved by us. For instance, it may use third parties to help host the website. These Service Providers may have access to your personal information for a limited time only, but whenever this occurs, we should have a reasonable contractual and technical protections in place to restrict their use of data to helping them provide the service. All data is encrypted via SSL/TLS during transmission. The data is protected within commercially acceptable means to prevent loss and theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use or modification. We employ administrative, physical and electronic measures designed to protect your information from unauthorized access. However, should a security breach take place, the affected users will be informed as soon as possible by our Support department. Legal requests or prevention of harm Your information can be accessed, preserved and shared with regulators, law enforcement or others: In response to a legal request (like a search warrant, court order or subpoena) if there is a good faith belief that the law requires to do so. This may include responding to legal requests from jurisdictions outside the United States when there is a good-faith belief that the response is required by law in that jurisdiction, affects users in that jurisdiction, and is consistent with internationally recognized standards. When there is a good-faith belief it is necessary to: detect, prevent and address fraud, unauthorized use of the services, violations of our or policies, or other harmful or illegal activity; to protect ourselves (including our rights, property or services), you or others, including as part of investigations or regulatory inquiries; or to prevent death or imminent bodily harm. For example, if relevant, the information can be provided to and received from third-party partners about the reliability of your account to prevent fraud, abuse and other harmful activity on and off our services. The information received about you can be accessed and preserved for an extended period when it is the subject of a legal request or obligation, governmental investigation, or investigations of possible violations of our or policies, or otherwise to prevent harm. The information from accounts disabled for violations can be retained for at least a year to prevent repeat abuse or other term violations. for Using Google API This describes how the FRP Hospitality application We, FRP LLC uses information obtained from users through the Google API. We are committed to protecting users' privacy and ensuring the security of their data while using the following Google API services: Google Contacts, Google Calendar, and Gmail. 1. Information We Collect In the course of using Google API services, the FRP Hospitality application may collect the following information: Google Contacts: The name and email address of contacts, which are used to simplify communication with guests. Google Calendar: Event details, such as event title, date, time, and participant list, are used for managing bookings and scheduling events. Gmail: Gmail access is used solely for sending emails to guests related to events scheduled in the calendar. We do not collect or store the content of other emails or metadata beyond this purpose. 2. How We Use the Collected Information We use the information obtained through the Google API exclusively to ensure the proper functioning of the FRP Hospitality application. Examples of data usage include: Google Contacts: The name and email address of contacts are used for auto-filling contact details during bookings and guest management. Google Calendar: Calendar data is used to manage the schedule of events and bookings, as well as to send notifications and reminders. Gmail: Used only to send emails to guests related to events scheduled in the calendar. 3. Information Sharing We strictly limit access to the data and ensure that no data obtained through the Google API is shared with third parties, sold, or rented. All data is used solely for the operation of the FRP Hospitality application. 4. Data Security We take all necessary measures to protect data from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. This includes the use of modern security and encryption technologies, as well as regular checks of our systems for security vulnerabilities. 5. User Access and Data Management Users have the ability to manage their data collected through the Google API via the FRP Hospitality application interface. Users can view, modify, or delete their data at their discretion. 6. User Consent By using our application, the user agrees to this and grants us permission to access and use data through the Google API solely for the purposes stated above. 7. Changes to the We reserve the right to make changes to this at any time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated effective date. 8. Contact Information If you have any questions regarding this or our data practices, please contact us: support@frp.ai.

frp® bl mobile application is a part of an Enterprise-class stand-alone application that is managed by an Enterprise authorized personnel that have rights to manage accounts within the Enterprise setup. Collecting and Using personal data frp® bl mobile application uses personal information for the following purposes: to verify your identity when accessing frp® bl system to provide you the features of the application to customize your experience with the application The data being provided for accessing the application does not necessarily enable to identify someone personally. However, the system can be configured asking to provide name, email, telephone number, etc for registration. That information is collected by fair means, with knowledge and consent from the customer side. The collected information is retained for as long as necessary to provide the requested service. Any information provided to frp® bl is entirely user's/customer's choice. However, in compliance with the GDPR, if someone would like to make a subject access request, rectify or delete your data, restrict and object to processing or lodge a complaint with a data protection authority, they are perfectly entitled to do so. For this they contact Support department of the Enterprise organization with any such requests, and they will strive to respond to him/her in no later than 30 days. What kinds of information does the application collect? Information and content you provide. The Enterprise authorized personnel collect the content, communications and other information you provide when you use the services, including when you for an account, create content. This can include information in or about the content you provide (like metadata), such as the location of a photo or the date a file was created. Things others do and information they provide about you. The Enterprise authorized personnel also can receive and analyse content that other people provide when they use the services provided by the application. This can include information about you. Information that is obtained from a mobile device includes: Identifiers: unique identifiers, device IDs, and other identifiers. How is this information used? The information is used to deliver frp® bl . Face recognition: The application uses face recognition technology to recognize you in photos, videos and camera experiences. Any personally identifying information is not shared publicly or with third-parties, except when legally required to do so. When the information can be shared? The information may be disclosed to Service Providers approved by the Enterprise. For instance, it may use third parties to help host the website. These Service Providers may have access to your personal information for a limited time only, but whenever this occurs, the Enterprise should have a reasonable contractual and technical protections in place to restrict their use of data to helping them provide the service. The data stored by frp® bl application is protected within commercially acceptable means to prevent loss and theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use or modification. frp® bl stores data on an Enterprise secured servers behind a firewall, the data is encrypted using SSL technology. However, should a security breach take place, the affected users will be informed as soon as possible by the Enterprise Support department. Legal requests or prevention of harm Your information can be accessed, preserved and shared with regulators, law enforcement or others: In response to a legal request (like a search warrant, court order or subpoena) if there is a good faith belief that the law requires to do so. This may include responding to legal requests from jurisdictions outside the United States when there is a good-faith belief that the response is required by law in that jurisdiction, affects users in that jurisdiction, and is consistent with internationally recognized standards. When there is a good-faith belief it is necessary to: detect, prevent and address fraud, unauthorized use of the services, violations of our or policies, or other harmful or illegal activity; to protect ourselves (including our rights, property or services), you or others, including as part of investigations or regulatory inquiries; or to prevent death or imminent bodily harm. For example, if relevant, the information can be provided to and received from third-party partners about the reliability of your account to prevent fraud, abuse and other harmful activity on and off our services. The information received about you can be accessed and preserved for an extended period when it is the subject of a legal request or obligation, governmental investigation, or investigations of possible violations of our or policies, or otherwise to prevent harm. The information from accounts disabled for violations can be retained for at least a year to prevent repeat abuse or other term violations. Consent to collection and processing in the United States By using frp® bl , you consent to having your personal data processed by frp® bl . We reserve the right to change this at any time. Unless otherwise stated, our current applies to all the information that the Enterprise possess about you and your account. If changes to this is made, you will be notified by publishing the most recent version on this web page. If you have any questions or suggestions about the , do not hesitate to contact us at support@frp.ai.

Headquartered in the scenic islands of Hawaii, USA, FRP® is pioneering the future of security and operational analytics with our state-of-the-art software solutions. Specializing in machine vision and artificial intelligence, our products are engineered to enhance visitor traffic monitoring and sophisticated access control systems. Our versatile technology caters to both dynamic entrepreneurs and global enterprises, including leading network retailers who trust our platform for comprehensive Asset Protection. Recognized by NIST and ranking highly in its prestigious annual assessments, FRP® sets the standard for innovation and reliability in the security tech industry. Our products are not just tools — they are gateways to safer, smarter business practices that protect assets and streamline operations.
